title: Mattel launch BTS Mini Dolls and they’re so cute we want them all
text:
BTS are getting even cuter (Picture: Big Hit)

We’re suckers for BTS merch, and their latest project could be the band’s cutest yet.

Mattel has confirmed their second collaboration with the K-pop superstars following their full-size BTS doll collection, and the boys are getting downsized.

The company has announced their range of BTS Mini Dolls, with RM, Jimin, Jungkook, V, J-Hope, Jin and Suga each getting their own miniature figurine.

And needless to say, we want them all.

Mattel has given each member their own style (Picture: Mattel)

An adorable trailer for House of BTS showed the animated dolls performing Idol, with ‘V’ taking a tumble at the end as the others giggled away.

Now, Mattel has confirmed that the dolls will soon be available for $9.99 (£7.63) each.

The dolls all have their own quirky style – V is rocking two-tone hair and a heart-dotted shirt; RM looks cool with blue hair and a cardigan; Suga is wearing ripped jeans and a jumper with an apple on the front; J-Hope is rocking glasses and a bunny sweater; Jin is all suited u[; Jimin is wearing a cap and a sporty sweater; and Jungkook has red hair and his initials on a t-shirt.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The dolls will be available globally, while giant models of the dolls have been displayed at the House of BTS in Seoul.

J-Hope fits right in (Picture: Twitter/BTS)

And some of the band dropped by to pose with their plastic selves, with Jimin taking a selfie with his own doll and J-Hope taking a group shot.

Adorable.

The House of BTS opened in Gangnam on 18 October and will be open until 5 January, with lucky shoppers able to buy 200 types of merchandise.

Ouch, our bank accounts.

To keep the ARMY coming back, new merch based on BTS’s songs will be introduced every week, while there’s numerous interactive showrooms and photo opportunities across the four-floor exhibit.

The House of BTS will also open in Tokyo, Osaka and Fukuoka in Japan from 23 November to 29 December.
